citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
In one of the facility’s catteries (A-3) containing 10 cats that were not on a protocol, one 3-year-old male, “Lincoln,”
(microchip number 981020041853247) was observed to have a reddened area around all of the right eye. There was a
mild amount of clear watery-like discharge present on the inner corner of the right eye. “Lincoln” was also observed
occasionally squinting the right eye. The animal appeared otherwise healthy. The facility’s animal care staff stated the
cats in A-3 had been observed that morning, prior to the inspection; however, these clinical signs had not been identified
during the observation. Failure to provide adequate daily observation of all the animals and prompt notification to the
attending veterinarian regarding problems on animal health, behavior, and well-being may delay care and cause undue
pain, discomfort, or stress. The facility must maintain a comprehensive method to perform daily observations of all
animals to assess their health and well-being, identify problems, and assure direct and timely communication with the
attending veterinarian. Correct by December 19, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.33(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
In one of the facility’s catteries (A-3) containing 10 cats that were not on a protocol, one 3-year-old male, “Lincoln,” 
(microchip number 981020041853247) was observed to have a reddened area around all of the right eye. There was a 
mild amount of clear watery-like discharge present on the inner corner of the right eye. “Lincoln” was also observed 
occasionally squinting the right eye. The animal appeared otherwise healthy. The facility’s animal care staff stated the 
cats in A-3 had been observed that morning, prior to the inspection; however, these clinical signs had not been identified 
during the observation. Failure to provide adequate daily observation of all the animals and prompt notification to the 
attending veterinarian regarding problems on animal health, behavior, and well-being may delay care and cause undue 
pain, discomfort, or stress. The facility must maintain a comprehensive method to perform daily observations of all 
animals to assess their health and well-being, identify problems, and assure direct and timely communication with the 
attending veterinarian. Correct by December 19, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
